title: Ornithology
description:
The scientific study of birds, including their biology and behavior.
Example: Bird Science

title: Avian Evolution
description:
The evolutionary history and origin of birds from reptilian ancestors.
Example: Dinosaur-Bird Connection

title: Feathers
description:
Specialized structures made of keratin that aid in flight and insulation.
Example: Eagle Feathers

title: Flight Adaptations
description:
Structural and physiological traits enabling birds to fly.
Example: Hummingbird Wings

title: Avian Skeletal System
description:
The lightweight, fused bone structure that supports flight.

title: Bird Respiration
description:
A highly efficient respiratory system that allows sustained flight.

title: Endothermy
description:
The ability to maintain a constant body temperature internally.

title: Avian Brain
description:
The advanced brain structure in birds supporting learning and navigation.

title: Beak Adaptations
description:
Modifications of the beak for feeding on various food sources.

title: Bird Vision
description:
Exceptional vision adapted for detecting prey and navigation.

title: Bird Hearing
description:

title: Plumage
description:

title: Molting
description:
The process of shedding old feathers to grow new ones.

title: Migratory Behavior
description:

title: Seasonal Migration
description:
The seasonal relocation of birds to exploit different climates and resources.

title: Navigation in Birds

description:

title: Stopover Sites

title: Flyways
description:

title: Resident Birds
description:

title: Altitudinal Migration
description:

title: Partial Migration
description:
A migration pattern where only some individuals migrate.

title: Nomadic Movement
description:

title: Avian Ecology
description:

title: Bird Nesting

title: Brood Parasitism

title: Clutch Size
description:

title: Courtship Displays
